title: nn.Parameter.new returns Variable instead of nn.Parameter
body_html:
torch.__version__ == '0.4.0a0+4ae0579'

import torch

p = torch.nn.Parameter()
print(type(p))
# <class 'torch.nn.parameter.Parameter'>

q = p.new()
print(type(q))
# <class 'torch.autograd.variable.Variable'>

Similar issue about nn.Parameter.type_as(...), it currently returns a Variable.

Similar issue about nn.Parameter.type_as(...), it currently returns a Variable.
body:
`torch.__version__ == '0.4.0a0+4ae0579'`
```python
import torch

p = torch.nn.Parameter()
print(type(p))
# <class 'torch.nn.parameter.Parameter'>

q = p.new()
print(type(q))
# <class 'torch.autograd.variable.Variable'>
```

Similar issue about `nn.Parameter.type_as(...)`, it currently returns a Variable.
